reviews.review_msg: cool dude and great prof

The lectures and readings are scattered and unclear. The exam cheat sheet he gives you for the final is again all over the place, and the questions that are presented are absurd. A very nice man, who is great help during his office hours, but just does a terrible job teaching and structuring the course.

Worst class I have ever taken. While Prof. Ross is a fantastic academic and clearly knows his material, the delivery of his lectures, the wide breadth of content assigned in weekly readings (interesting but scattered) and the overall disorganization of the class make it utterly terrible. The Syllabus had 2 sentence description for a 40% paper.

One of the best Poli Sci profs I've ever had. He makes you work for your grade but is always available for help and really goes above and beyond if you ask. There are pop quizzes and no final but he usually tells you when the quizzes are and what readings they're on (there are a lot). Don't look for the big picture, memorize the numbers and names.

Ross is a very fair man. You have to do all the reading to excel in his class. Is also a very writing intensive course, just keep in mind that this is a 4th year course and 4th year level course work is expected.

Ross is very interesting and knowledgeable but his lectures consist of long rants and are very disorganized. Make sure you read all of the readings because that's whats being tested not his rants in class. There are movies in lecture every class that are interesting. A hard final exam, but overall the class was enjoyable despite its shortcomings.

He's a really interesting prof, and clearly brilliant, but his lectures are a little bit chaotic and hard to follow/take notes on. I loved the readings and they never felt like work, but I wish this had been a seminar, because I feel like he'd be awesome to have as a seminar prof.

Overall it was a decent class. However the tutorials were much more useful than the lectures. The lectures were often off topic and turned into him ranting about random subjects. I admit I missed a few of them but still got a decent grade. However, I don't think I would take another class with him. Turns an interesting subject into something boring

Teaching style does not do favours for this class There is literally no structure for his lectures and they are essentially long rants This does not adequately prepare you at all for the final so you have to end up teaching yourself all the material through the textbook. You need to be a military historian to do well Would not take this class again

The most amazing prof at SFU! He is very interested in his field. His lectures are always engaging and makes a 4-hour class pass by very quickly. The current events sections in his lectures always tie in with the lecture theme and come in handy for the papers and exams. Best political science professor!
Takes a real interest in his students. Upper level seminars with him are the best since he's willing to engage in real discussions with his students. Lectures are so-so. He really loves planes haha
Seriously rather would watch the news on TV instead of going to his class. Utterly pointless really.

He is a lovely man, however, his teaching style leaves a lot to be desired.  His lecture consists of a self-talk about current events, followed by a Hollywood film and then a half hour seminar discussion, on which your participation grade is determined (80 kids in the class- kind of makes it hard). A real shame that this course is taught so poorly.
Douglas Ross is one of the greatest men that has ever lived.

Prof is very helpful towards papers and presentation topics.. all you have to do is ask him his opinion and he will typically rample off an answer or two that can really help you out. The final exam was said to be hard but there were only 2 essay questions and you had to choose 5 definitons out of literally 50. Great Prof, Will take another course

I was intimidated going into the class. I was pleasantly surprised that he is nothing like the comments written about him.  Incredible caring professor.  I love the way he brings contemporary politics into the class.  Fair marker.  He reminds me of one of those seasoned generals who have been there done that knows everything.  highly recommended.

Had two classes with him. He is a knowledgeable prof, friendly, and marking is usually fair, so-so. His only downside is that he keeps very low engagement in class by talking for too long, not very clearly. Very high "fall asleep" rate, even on important topics. He is big on plagiarism, and I really like that he is open to any kind of discussion.

He, and I suppose the TA as well, suspected I plagarized (I am a good writer and put lot's of effort into my papers) so he deducted massive points for an inconsequential oversight. I had to confront him to get my grade back. It's not like I haven't experienced that type of behavior directed towards me before.

Dr. Ross speaks clearly and can effectively communicate most concepts to students. His lecture style was relatively engaging and the material he presented was on the whole interesting. I would take another class with him.
No Comments

This course has far too much potential to be taught in this manner. A two-hour movie in every three hour lecture left no time for him to teach. He consistenly returned graded papers in an untimely fashion and could not even report the final grades on time. I would wholeheartedly recommend the department find someone else to teach this course.

Awesome Prof! Great sense of humour; extremely knowledgeable; very interesting lecturer.  Does not spend much time reviewing text material (it is a 300-level course after all), but instead reviews current events and screens relevant films. Best TA (Lidia) I have ever had. Challenging but worthwhile. Course material was fascinating! Lots of writing.

Every class he shows a film. The material is very interesting as he has selected highly relevant readings. There is a disconnect between the films and the final exam, so make sure to do the readings! It really isn't necessary to take notes during the films; the exam is based on readings and notes.
Excellent professor. Learned so much new concepts.
He does not even lecture. He rambles for about 1/2 hour each class and you do not even know what is important. Way too much expected for the final exam.

Have you ever been dragged to a movie you didn't want to go to? And sat next to an annoying friend who never shut up the whole time? Well multiply that by 100 and you have some idea of what this man's teaching style is like.
avoid
Right on, he's getting paid big bucks to show flicks like Braveheart and Syriana. Good movies but come on. This shiould be a film studies course.lol
Showing Hollywood movies for 2.5 hrs of a 3 hr lecture (every lecture) doesn't constitute lecturing. What a joke. Good gig if you can get it.

Absolutely god-awful.  I suspect he may be a brilliant political scientist, but he's a horrible professor.  Rambling notes in ALL-CAPS and really hard to pick out what he thought was important.  Oh yeah, and the world's going to end.  Tomorrow.

One of the worst profs. i've ever had, so random with his wasteful lectures and holywood movies..i thought this class would be so good, i couldn't have been more wrong. the quizs are so insane and the final exam was so hard for only 20%!!!

Very disorganized.Wastes precious lecture time on Hollywood films instead of lecturing on material read in texts. This indicates that he is unwilling to put in the time for creating an organized and coherent set of lectures.Final exam is unreasonable for 20% (3 essays and 10 concepts). 600 spent on watching films that I have seen. Do not recommend!

Extrememly good teacher. Best class I have taken in a long time. His movies are great, his lectures are funny, and his TA's are awesome. The paper is long, but he gives you options, emails you the lecture notes and is extremely helpful. Those that complain have no clue and forget that school involves work.

Yes, he is very hard and his expectations for a 100 level class were too high. However, he was a fair teacher and for an upper level class I'm sure he would be very good. He has Teaching Excellence awards, so he cares about his students. If you work hard and do the readings (which is expected in University)you will be fine. He does bash religion.
No Comments
one of the worst profs I've ever had, he's prejudiced against religion and continually bashed it in his lectures

Note that any of the good reviews come from upper division classes. This guy was on sabbatical and has been eased back into teaching with POL 100, which is supposed to be an intro course. However, Ross teaches it like an upper division or graduate level class. Not really introductory. The essays are marked hard, especially with his reviews. Take a

Ross is obviously very knowledgeable reagarding politics but he is a little out of touch with what an appropriate course load for first years is though. 200-300 level. Gotta thank him for giving very specific outlines for midterm and exam though.  lectures did tend to drag at times...

PLEASE STOP THE DAILY NEWS READINGS!!! He is probably a better instructor for higher level courses because his overhead notes are complicated and articulation are just too much for first years. I expected to get an "introduction" but it seemed more like a 3rd year course!
Knows his stuff. He's tough, but you learn much from him. Dont take it expecting an easy A, but do expect to learn something.

remember to drink a cup of large coffee before class. this guy is extrememly difficult. make sure that you have a strong background in politics. the midterm was insanely difficult, cuz it was basically a 3 hour midterm, but we only got 2 hours to write it.
acually, its a 2000 word research paper for first years.this class is extremely disorganized. there's no indication of what to study, and what concepts we should know.

just horrible.DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS!this is not a 100-level course,its a 300 level course.first-years beware!This is a weeder course, you're better off taking calculus!His teaching method is non-existent, he only discusses current events,which makes everyone fall asleep.readings are brutal,no quality help available.10000 word essay,for first years!
quite avaricious in nordacious equilibrium
He was the best prof I ever had. Good analysis,genuine interest in his students, very approachable. I looked forward to his classes.
Absolutely brilliant.  The best of the best!

Dr. Ross is great.  People that complain about his quizzes haven't done the readings, because they're not that hard.  He tells you exactly what is going to be on the final (giving you a list of questions, and then choosing from those.)  He's the best prof I've had here at SFU.
The very best
annoying quizes, aimless lectures and plenty of films not related to course material. take this class if you want to watch braveheart instead of learn about current events/politics.
Brilliant analysis but very depressing.

Appears to put very little effort into class; Quizes difficult and final totally unreasonable (10 concepts and 3 essays for a final worth 20%??). While he shows interest in subject material, he is clearly not capable of teaching it.
Knows a lot, but readings don't relate to class at all.  Nice guy, but ridiculous quizes that are impossible.  Not really an enjoyable class over all.

Excellent professor, one of the few who allows those on the right to express their views. Does a lot of interesting current event stuff. The quizzes are really hard though, but other than that you learn a lot!!
obviously cares very little about his students.  Does not stick to lession plans nor does he prepare lectures in advance.  This leads to a useless waste of two hours of babbling nonesence.
Ross is a demanding professor but his lectures are interesting and current. However the readings on nuclear war, and weapons of mass destruction might cause some loss of sleep!
Taking this class led me to take nuclear war seriously! Balanced moderator in class discussions, even-handed analysis and he won't let you forsake the realists.
Very knowledgable and interesting, knows and likes lots of technical details
He's big into nukes, missiles, doomsday predictions and all that cool stuff.
the best.
Lectures will honestly change your life, global perspective. A must prof in IR.
Brought the subject matter home.
One of the most knowledgable and civil-conscious professor.  Highly recommended.
